parameter-metadata.display-name: Defines relative/absolute time representation in alarm related views
parameter-metadata.help: Check to enable relative time representation, otherwise - absolute

parameter-metadata.help: Timeout on moving cleared alarms to historical (in Minutes)

parameter-metadata.help: Timeout on moving single events to historical (in hours)
load the internal send-queue for traps (1 = slow as possible, 9 = fast as possible), default is 1*10 traps per 2 sec
load the internal send-queue for traps (1 = slow as possible, 9 = fast as possible), default is 3*10 traps per 3 sec

parameter-metadata.help: Accept Syslog Messages from Devices filtered with specified severity

Sets the size of the worker thread pool. (min 20, max 100)
Sets the default number of worker threads used per operation. (min 10, max 50)
Sets the maximum number of traps accepted from a single device in any 30 second period. (min 5, max 60)
Sets the total number of traps accepted in any 1 minute period. (min 100, max 275)

parameter-metadata.display-name: Syslog messages per Device in 30 Sec
parameter-metadata.help: Sets the maximum number of syslog messages accepted from a single device in any 30 second period. (min 20, max 250)

parameter-metadata.display-name: Total syslog messages Accepted per Minute
parameter-metadata.help: Sets the total number of syslog messages accepted in any 1 minute period. (min 100, max 275)

parameter-metadata.display-name: Drop SNMP traps/syslog messages from device on High trap/syslog rate Alarm
parameter-metadata.help: Drop SNMP traps or syslog messages recivced from device if Ridgeline detects a High trap rate or high syslog message rate on device
Sets the number of concurrent interactive telnet sessions. (min 1, max 10)

Number of retries before timing out

String format for port in the tree

parameter-metadata.help: Maximum number of days to keep events. Older events will be taken as backup by Alarm backup task
